newsitem.title: UK: Rolls Royce part of JSF contract.
newsitem.headline: Rolls Royce part of JSF contract.

text.p: Rolls-Royce Plc said on Wednesday that it is to share in a multi-year $96 million contract awarded by the US Joint Strike Fighter (JSF) Programme Office.
It said in a statement the contract was awarded to GE Aircraft Engines, Allison Advanced Development Company and Rolls-Royce Military Aero Engines for the JSF Alternate Engine Programme.
GE Aircraft Engines is part of General Electric and Allison Engine Co. Inc. is owned by Rolls-Royce.
Rolls-Royce Military Aero Engines joined a GE/Allison team in March 1996 to develop and produce the YF120 cruise engine for the JSF Programme.
Under the GE/Allison/Rolls-Royce team agreement, GE will initially act as the lead systems integrator for the engine development work.
Rolls-Royce said that the programme office has estimated that more than 3,000 JSF aircraft could be needed by the year 2030.
